text: Stephen Fuller Austin (November 3, 1793 â€“ December 27, 1836) was an American politician and landowner. He was known as the "Father of Texas" and the founder of Texas. He led the second and successful colonization of Texas by bringing 300 families from the United States to the region in 1825. The city of Austin, Texas is named after him. ==References== Category:1793 births Category:1836 deaths Category:Politicians from Virginia Category:Politicians from Austin, Texas Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:State legislators of the United States Category:Infectious disease deaths in Texas
title: Stephen F. Austin
